name: Hardware
definition: The physical and electronic components that make up a computer and execute instructions.

name: Software
definition: Programs and operating systems that provide the instructions hardware follows to perform tasks.

name: Central Processing Unit
definition: The core processor that interprets instructions, performs arithmetic and logic operations, and manages data movement.

name: Memory Hierarchy
definition: The layered organization of storage that balances access speed, cost, and capacity from registers to secondary storage.

name: Input Output System
definition: The collection of components that connect the computer to external devices and manage data transfer.

name: Control Unit
definition: The CPU component that directs the operation of the processor by decoding instructions and coordinating internal activities.

name: Arithmetic Logic Unit
definition: The CPU section that executes arithmetic calculations and logical comparisons.

name: Registers
definition: High-speed storage locations used by the CPU to hold data and intermediate results during instruction execution.

name: Instruction Decoder
definition: The circuit that interprets the binary operation code of each instruction and signals which action the CPU should take.

name: Program Counter
definition: A register that holds the address of the next instruction to fetch and execute from memory.

name: Adder Circuit
definition: A circuit that performs binary addition and provides sum and carry outputs used in arithmetic operations.

name: Comparator Circuit
definition: A circuit that compares two binary values and determines if one is greater, less, or equal to the other.

name: Full Adder
definition: A logic circuit that adds three binary inputs—two operands and a carry input—to produce a sum and carry output.

name: Logic Gates
definition: Basic digital circuits that implement Boolean operations used to build larger computational components.

name: AND Gate
definition: A gate that outputs true only if all inputs are true, representing logical conjunction.

name: OR Gate
definition: A gate that outputs true if at least one input is true, representing logical disjunction.

name: Accumulator
definition: A register that stores intermediate arithmetic and logic results produced by the ALU.

name: Instruction Register
definition: A register that holds the instruction currently being decoded or executed by the CPU.

name: Memory Address Register
definition: A register that stores the address in memory of the next data or instruction to access.

name: Cache Memory
definition: A small, high-speed memory close to the CPU that stores frequently accessed data to reduce average memory access time.

name: Main Memory
definition: Volatile memory that temporarily stores programs and data currently in use by the CPU.

name: Secondary Storage
definition: Non-volatile storage used to keep data permanently even when power is turned off.

name: L1 Cache
definition: The smallest and fastest level of cache integrated directly into the CPU core.

name: L2 Cache
definition: A larger, slower cache that stores recently used data and instructions not found in L1.

name: L3 Cache
definition: A shared cache among processor cores that provides another layer before main memory access.

name: Instruction Cache
definition: A cache that holds recently fetched instructions to reduce fetch time for repeated code execution.

name: Data Cache
definition: A cache that holds recently used data values to speed up data reads and writes.

name: RAM Modules
definition: Modules containing DRAM chips that hold active programs and data temporarily for fast CPU access.

name: Memory Controller
definition: A circuit that manages data transfers between the CPU and RAM, handling timing and addressing operations.

name: DRAM Chips
definition: Dynamic memory chips that store bits as electrical charges refreshed periodically to retain data.

name: Memory Cells
definition: Individual DRAM storage units consisting of one transistor and one capacitor that store a single binary bit.

name: Transistor
definition: A semiconductor device used as a switch to control the flow of electrical signals in a circuit.

name: Capacitor
definition: An electronic component that stores and releases electric charge representing binary information.

name: Hard Disk Drive
definition: A magnetic storage device that uses rotating platters and heads to store large volumes of data persistently.

name: Solid State Drive
definition: A storage device that uses flash memory cells instead of moving parts to achieve faster access times.

name: Disk Platters
definition: Circular disks coated with magnetic material where binary data is stored in microscopic regions.

name: Read Write Head
definition: A magnetic sensor that moves across disk platters to read and write binary data.

name: Magnetic Surface
definition: The coated surface on a disk platter that stores bits as magnetized regions.

name: Magnetic Domains
definition: Tiny magnetic regions on a platter surface with uniform orientation representing stored bits.

name: IO Controllers
definition: Specialized circuits that manage communication and data flow between the CPU and external devices.

name: USB Controller
definition: A controller chip that handles communication and data transfer between the computer and USB-connected devices.

name: Peripheral Devices
definition: External hardware components that provide input to or receive output from the computer.

name: Keyboard
definition: An input device that converts key presses into digital signals for system processing.

name: Monitor
definition: An output device that displays visual information produced by the computer.
